column2: A corral devoted to the training and housing of warhorses has been constructed to permanently garrison sturdy mounted knights within this settlement.
This retinue of mounted knights has become fiercer and quite large, and it is a force capable of slaying and trampling a retinue of similar size.
These stables are dedicated to war. The warhorses and men that ride them are truly a force to be reckoned with.
The knights borne and trained in these corrals are borderline superhuman, thanks to the hearty, fierce and beast-like mounts they ride into battle.
Small groups of mages have come together to found and construct a small enchanted outcropping where hedge mages and rogue casters can come and congregate.
The previously disorganized group of mages have built, or rather summoned, a large stone tower acting as a magical foci and repository for arcane knowledge.
This tower of the arcane draws upon untold amounts of ley energy in the area, further empowering the mages that find their home and family within.
A grand pinnacle surging with raw arcane energy finds itself having changed the environment around it. The flora and fauna find themselves rather enchanted and magical spells are heavily empowered.
A small cloister of human monks has been founded within the temple here with some of the monks being knowledgeable in the magical arts.
More religious minded men and women have gathered to form a convent within the temple, bringing greater prestige and piety to the local abbot and liege.
Separate from the primary temple, an isolated abbey has been constructed to better house the more devout worshipers of the area.
Perhaps reigning in the most prestige, a grand monastery stands gilded and royal isolated away from most of civilization.
Magical shops selling enchanted baubles, wands, and enchanting materials have opened throughout the settlement bringing a rather niche market to an otherwise drab marketplace.
Centralized around the mage shops and industry, a large portal hall has been constructed allowing for quick travel around the city and the region.
Quarters specifically built for magical research and housing has been built in this part of the settlement
A large portion of the city has been dedicated to the magical arts, research, culture, and industry, drastically changing the dynamic of every citizen in town.
A part of the city has been dedicated for recreational use through the construction of a moderately sized park.
Community members have begun managing gardens and other activities within the park grounds
Herbalists and alchemists alike have found good business within the city by utilizing the city park as a source of well-grown natural herbs and ingredients.
A large section of the city has been portioned off to make room for a large park district, home to herbalists, alchemists, and other natural arts.
Groups of wild worg tamers have set up camps around the the settlement, bringing trained worgs into our retinue.
Permanent pens to contain the growing number of worgs have been built, allowing the tamers to more efficiently breed and train worgs for war.
The previous worg pens have been upgraded into professionally worked corrals to better train and grow the size of this region's worg population.
Worgs are outfitted for total war at these tables, turning them into well-armored and vicious man eating machines.
Orcs gather in this camp to prepare and rally for warfare. Orc brethren in the region bond together and perform better in raids and overall war.
Orc warriors celebrate victory in raids and war, and their cheers and drinking can be heard echoing throughout this aptly named Hall of Victory.
This Glory Hold provides a source of war inspiration for Orcs as well as a fortified hall for celebration, merriment, and rallies.
A grand bastion has been erected in this settlement as a testament to the war-faring capabilities of the Orc people. At any moment, the howling and roaring of countless warriors echo from within.
Stones have been erected in a circular fashion in order to better allow Orc shamans communion with the elemental spirits.
The stones have been carved with shamanic runes and inscriptions further connecting shamans with the elements.
Shrines have been dedicated to the elemental lords and their servants thereby increasing the power attainable by this region's shamanic retinue.
The elements favor this settlement because of its great circle of the elements. The shamans here enjoy great and clear communion with all of the elements convening around the stones.
Housing dedicated to the shaman population of the keep has been built away from the keep, allowing unfettered communion.
Shamans have practically been given their own fiefdom within the keep's grounds. More orcs flee to the shamanic life as their influence grows.
Shamans throughout these grounds have begun training for a life of war and harnessing the elements for destruction.
A grand hold has been erected to better house war shamans and to allow for more efficient training.
Several peons of the hold have begun settling down and setting up tents around the walls of the settlement.
Tents have become full blown encampments as the peon population of the settlement begins to explode.
Unable to stably build up, our peons have instead begun to build down into the earth, as they are unable to depend on our walls for defense.
Winding streets of slums house our peon population within and outside of our settlement creating a nearly endless workforce we may direct anywhere we please.
Orc warriors spar with each other in these fields so they may better prepare themselves for one on one combat.
Pits have been dug for warriors to spare in to better contain blood spills and the unfortunate victims who do not survive.
Dueling grounds have been erected for the more veteran warriors, and they are used to even further hone skills envied by lesser orcs.
Orcs, warriors and peons, from all around cheer and howl from the outside of this grand arena as orc champions battle from within its walls.
Tuskarr hunters are trained in the art of trapping and befriending the local turtle population.
A greater effort is made into trapping some of the larger sea turtles and equipping the turtles with armor where they aren't covered by their shells.
Extensive efforts are made with breeding a larger turtle population, which will serve the proud Kalu'ak well.
A huge War Turtle breeding and equipping complex, maintaining several levels of turtles in various sizes, from Kalu'ak turtle ships to armored war turtles
Some Tuskarr are trained in the art producing equipment from whale leather.
The local tuskarrs are trained in the making of bone char, which provides them with this new option to stoke the fires of industry.
The industry around the Tuskarrs bone char is expanding, to meet the needs of an ever expanding Tuskarr industry.
A vast complex around the Kalu'ak Bone char furnaces are producing armaments for the brave Tuskarr armies.
Tuskarr spell-casters are often attended by small parties of javelin throwers, driving enemies towards the spell-casters
A small gathering of several smaller Kalu'ak statues attended by the local spell-casters
A larger amount of Tuskarr stone statues are lined along local roadways.
A colossal Tuskarr statue towers over the nearby castle.
To the Tuskarr family is everything, with a small shrine that the Kalu'ak can gather new knowledge might be uncovered
The strong bond of kin, naturally leads the conversation that the casters of Kalu'ak to protect their tribe
A construction of a meeting hall around the shrine will further enhance further studies
An extensive meeting hall with where the Kalu'ak can discuss.
Instead of forming larger raiding parties the Tuskarr prefers to send out trappers towards the local penguin population.
Designated areas are left alone for the local penguins except when they are needed for food.
Large areas of water and land are fenced in, allowing the penguins to still catch fish but prevents them from escaping
Extensive fences around the local penguins allows the Tuskarr to extract eggs and food at leisure
Tuskarr treat visitors bringing fish as great as long lost relatives, this hospitality must be the cornerstone of Tuskarr towns.
